data.title: Give gap tech exclusively to France
data.body: Although France's fake buildings got a buff, overall it is still pretty weak in comparison to the other factions. This PR proposes that France should exclusively build both the gap gen and gap truck.

data.title: Remove RA Tesla Tanks ability to crush infantry and walls
data.body:
In relation to #10426

This PR removes the TT's ability to crush infantry and walls. Its speed combined with the IC makes this too effective against massed infantry.

data.title: Ra mad tank balance/overhall
data.body:
the Mad tank has been changed so that it is more useful as a support infantry unit that still causes devastation
video: https://vid.me/CXgI

p.s forget about the other PR of this.... it was a grave mistake 
on the up side I spell checked it! now Damage is spelt with a capital :dancer:

data.title: Revert 2 bleed
Balance : Nerfing Tesla Tank ?
data.body:
Hello :)

Yesterday I've been testing the new Tesla Tank 
(http://s000.tinyupload.com/index.php?file_id=67625660725952331414)
- watching SoScared stream 
  (http://www.twitch.tv/soscared/v/33626018 ,  usage 51st min)

While Tesla tanks being now really fun and a good hit'n'run unit, it might have become a bit too strong in the this new release, because it has all the advantages : 
- High speed
- Good range
- High damage
- Quite good armor 
  (against tanks for instance, although 1 full Yak / Hind can destroy it
  EDIT : after second try, it's super fragile against all gun types ... but still)
- Crushing ability
- Turreted attack

It's almost like a "highspeed-hybrid-long-range-tank-unit" :) which could cause some balance issues.

Only disadvantages IMO :
- Anti-air vulnerability (but mixing with anti-air units (flaks especially) reduces this disadvantage)
- Fragile against gun-type (air, pillboxes, ...)
- Price / construction time maybe ? Not so high though.

Maybe one of these traits could be nerfed ? Not sure which one though 
(Speed ? As it is a tank. But that would reduce the hit'n'run ability, which is a nice trait of this unit.
Long range ? Why should they have bigger range than other tanks ?
Armor ?)

Thoughts ? :)
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29600935-balance-nerfing-tesla-tank?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Td build palette order change
data.body:
changed the build palette order so that it follows the tech tree
images of the change + poll can be found at: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=19220&postdays=0&postorder=asc&vote=viewresult

data.title: tesla tank doesn't auto attack while moving
data.body: so it got a buff which allows it to attack while moving but the thing is it doesn't auto attack while moving so you have to click on the enemy and then move and then once that enemy is dead you have to click on another. this is horrible when fighting vs infantry

data.title: MAD tank balance changes/overhall
data.body:
the Mad tank has been changed so that it is more useful as a support infantry unit that still causes devastation
video: https://vid.me/CXgI

data.title: Add support for multiple VoiceSets on an actor [Depends on sound setup rewrite]
data.body:
As wished by @DoGyAUT and company.
If multiple VoiceSets are provided, one will be chosen at random when the actor is created, and will be used for the entire lifetime of that actor.

data.title: Unhardcode music file types [Superseded]
data.body:
Use the code from  #10069 to unhardcode music file types like that PR unhardcoded sound (effects, speech, and such) file types.
#10032 would have to take this into account as well, sorry @teees . At least it looks like it should be pretty simple.

data.title: Weird Frame per second Issue
data.body:
When I start the game it completely freaks out FPS wise. How can I stabilize the frame rate so I'm not seeing all these weird black spots on the screen while the game is trying to put the frames in order?

data.title: Rename WW compression formats and move into Mods.Common.
data.body: Also moves VqaReader and IniFile.

data.title: Make Log thread-safe.
data.body:
Since logging is exposed via static methods, it need to be thread-safe or multiple threads trying to log at the same time will cause bad things to happen.

[Diff ignoring whitespace](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/10417/files?w=1)

data.title: Give the admin a 'Ready' checkbox even when in a spectator slot
data.body:

data.title: Reference the Map Scripting page from the Lua API page
data.body:
Kind of closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA-Resources/issues/270, as a link to the learning guide is on the `Map Scripting` page now (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA-Resources/issues/270#issuecomment-168691868).

When/If this is merged, I'll manually update the `Lua API` page.

Image:
![mapscripting](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/12093735/f02d516a-b304-11e5-89a4-35bc6c32545b.png)

data.title: Question : shoot over concrete walls bug ?
data.body:
Hello !

I have played a game where enemy riflemen could shoot over my concrete walls, when they were exactly behind them. If they are further away, their shots get stopped by the walls, which is the behaviour I'm familiar with. 

Is it a bug or is it intended ?

data.title: ra: buff minelayer's HP
data.body:
Currently 1 rocket soldier can kill a minelayer with 2 shots. With this
change a rocket soldier needs 5 rockets. This behaviour mimics the
light tank behaviour where a rocket soldier needs 5 rockets to kill it.
I think this buff is needed because light tank is a paper tank and
costs $700, but minelayer costs $800 and it's even less sturdy.

data.title: ra: decrease RevealsShroud for artillery
data.body:
Artillery is meant to be a support unit, so usually something else
(Hinds) provides vision to it. With reduced RevealsShroud riflers can
now at least have a slight chance approach artillery without being
killed.

data.title: Fix FrozenActorLayer.FootprintBounds.
data.body:
The size of the bounds was too small (as rectangle has exclusive edges on the right and bottom). This meant some intersection tests would fail and thus the frozen actor was not found when searching the partition bins.

Fixes #10403.

data.title: Fixed all known crashes in GlobalChat
data.body:
Fixes http://ingame.logs.openra.net/?year=2016&month=01&day=01#21:29:43
Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/10395.

data.title: Pinwheel of death on OS X El Capitan
data.body:
Installed the latest version of Mono 4.2 Stable (4.2.1.102) via the universal installer. When I start OpenRA it goes fullscreen, clears the screen, but then the pinwheel of death starts. I have to force quit OpenRA.

Running OS X El Capitan 10.11.3 Beta (15D9c).

Unfortunately, all of the OpenRA logs are empty:

```
  Logs  ll
total 0
-rw-r--r--+ 1 justin  staff     0B Jan  3 13:38 debug.log
-rw-r--r--+ 1 justin  staff     0B Jan  3 13:38 geoip.log
-rw-r--r--+ 1 justin  staff     0B Jan  3 13:38 graphics.log
-rw-r--r--+ 1 justin  staff     0B Jan  3 13:38 irc.log
-rw-r--r--+ 1 justin  staff     0B Jan  3 13:38 perf.log
-rw-r--r--+ 1 justin  staff     0B Jan  3 13:38 server.log
-rw-r--r--+ 1 justin  staff     0B Jan  3 13:38 sound.log
-rw-r--r--+ 1 justin  staff     0B Jan  3 13:38 syncreport.log
```

data.title: Fix the TS resource minimap colors.
data.body: Colors extracted from the minimap previews used by the original game.

data.title: Removed the RA mod DLL dependency from D2k
data.body: One step further towards #7526.

data.title: Removed GpsWatcher from Tiberian Sun
data.body: This will just waste resources.

data.title: Organized legacy map import into respective mod DLLs
data.body:
This organizes the legacy map import the way the utility commands are structured ~~now with a unified layout: `OpenRA.Utility.exe $mod --import-map FILENAME`~~. This sacrifices guessing ra/cnc for cleaner design: common methods are in Mods.Common while the mod specific stuff is in the correct DLL.

Also added support for parsing the `[Briefing]` section.

Removed the conversion tables that didn't convert anything and added the out-commented different crate types to the mod rules instead so that these won't be omitted.

data.title: Invisible and non-targetable flame turret on Monster Tank Madness
data.body:
The turret is in the middle of the three tanks, and you can see the fireball that it has just shot at the tank on the left:

![screen shot 2016-01-03 at 17 47 01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/12079929/59e6cd7a-b242-11e5-9266-517ba177138c.png)

It cannot be seen or manually targeted, but units will autotarget it.

Replay: https://www.dropbox.com/s/9c5sc9aehk3b10x/OpenRA-2016-01-03T174451Z.orarep?dl=0

data.title: Manual powering down is inconsistent in D2K
data.body:
Only four arbitrary buildings can be powered down: outpost and palace (but none of the other tech structures), starport (but none of the other production structures), and the missile turret (but not the gun turret).

We should either fix it properly (by defining and then implementing consistent rules for what can and can't be disabled) or (preferrably IMO) remove it completely.
